conclusion: To determine if the two objects have the same acceleration at time \( t_1 \), analyze the slope of the velocity-time graph for both objects.
Identify the slope at time \( t_1 \) for both objects A and B.
For object A, draw a tangent to the curve at \( t_1 \).
The slope of the tangent line for object A represents its acceleration at \( t_1 \).
For object B, draw a tangent to the curve at \( t_1 \).
The slope of the tangent line for object B represents its acceleration at \( t_1 \).
Compare the slopes of the tangents for both objects at \( t_1 \).
From the graph, the tangent lines at \( t_1 \) for both objects are shown.
The slope of the tangent line for object A at \( t_1 \) appears to be the same as the slope for object B.
Since the slopes of the tangent lines for both objects at time \( t_1 \) are the same, the accelerations of both objects at \( t_1 \) are equal.
Yes, the two objects have the same acceleration at time \( t_1 \).
